name: Melia Berlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was just an amazing hotel in every single way. From the location just next to the river to the awesome size and cleanliness of the room to the huge breakfast buffet. Stayed with a friend in a room with two single beds, they were huge though and so comfortable, wish I could have brought themhome with me. The AC in the room worked spotlessly in what turned out to be the hottest days in Berlin in 60 years. Staff were friendly although we did not interact too much with them. Restaurant seemed nice, regret not trying it since we had problems finding good places to eat (good research before going is recommended). All in all a great stay, don't think I will stay anywhere else when coming back to Berlin. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a very good time in the melia hotel , the lication is perfect so we could walk to pergamon museum or to brandenburg gate , a lot of restaurants in the area , the room was very nice and breafast perfect, so we had a nice vacation.
reviews.title: nice place in berlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best hotel experiences we've had. Great location near Friedrichstrasse train station allows you to get to anywhere using S and U bahn.
reviews.title: Great location, spotless, friendly and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Museums, Bundestag and Brandenburg Gate within walking distance. Highly recommend doing one of the 3-4 hour boar tours along the Spree and Landwehrkanal that start right next to the hotel. Very nice and clean rooms. Spotless. The hotel is fairly new (2006). The staff was friendly and very helpful (they helped me out with a phone charger). We had a 60 Euro meal voucher with our 2 night stay that we spent on a nice meal at the tapas restaurant. Great value for money.
reviews.title: 1st time in Berlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: Super Hotel, good location, excellent staff. Just back from two nights at the Melia, very comfortable hotel. One of the cleanest hotels that we have encountered worldwide, everywhere was spotless, Our Junior Suite on the 8th floor was superb, You can judge the level of cleanliness by a bathroom & this one was CLEAN, well appointed with all the amenities that you could expect. We overlooked Friedrichstrasse & the river. The Level was a pleasant oasis in the centre of a big city and Berlin is big !. The staff in The Level were exceptional ( Melia, you must be so proud of them, they are all first class ambassadors for the Hotel & Group). We received 60 euros between us by booking through the Melia website which we used on the second evening in the Restaurant, didn't plan it, but the bill came to 59.40 ! The lamb & beef were cooked to perfection, the gift from the kitchen was unexpected, but very tasty. The restaurant staff were again, as expected, first rate.
reviews.title: Heavenly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An absolute gem of a hotel! We just returned from 5 glorious days at this hotel which is right in the centre of the city, not even a 5 minute walk from Freidrickstrasse station. The central location makes it perfect for touring the city, close proximity to Brandenburg Gate, Unter den Linden, and the beautiful Reichtag which is amazing. You must prebook to enter this fantastic building beforehand for security reasons but you will not be disappointed. The Melia is also close to the river, Museum Island, and many interesting, reasonable restaurants. The staff at the Melia were all helpful and accommodating in every way. We stayed in a lovely room on the "Level" floor which gave us free access to the lounge which served breakfast every morning, and a light dinner every evening from 6-10:00. The view from our room was outstanding! They always had drinks,fruit, and internet services available. I had a nasty cold when I arrived in Berlin and the staff in the lounge were always offering me hot tea with honey. I can't say enough about how nice everyone who works there was. They even downloaded our boarding passes when we left for the airport to come home. We will definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Best location in Berlin! A wonderful experience!
Excellent location in centre of Berlin
reviews.text: We stayed here over August bank holiday and had a wonderful weekend. The hotel is about 2 minutes walk from Freidrickstrasse station, which is a 3 euro, 20 min journey from Schoenfeld airport. We did not have breakfast, as it was 20 euros - there are lots of places to eat within easy walking distance at much cheaper rates. The river cruises leave from the riverbank right next to the hotel - this is a great way to see this lovely city. The Reichstag is amazing - this is about 15 minutes gentle walk from the hotel, but make sure you register to visit beforehand - you can't just turn up there for security reasons. However, it is well worth the effort - the glass dome is fantastic, and it is all free. If you want to splash out there is a restaurant on the top, but you need to prebook there too. The staff at the Melia were all very helpful, the room was clean and very comfortable, and totally silent - you can't even hear toilets flushing! They have a secure luggage store, and are only too happy to store your bags in there on your final day. All in all, if we ever go back to Berlin, we will stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped here for three nights in August as part of our summer holiday in Germany and had a fabulous time. The hotel's central location makes it perfect for exploring the city, and it is just a few minutes walk to the Reichstag, Brandenburg Gate and Unter der Linden. The S and U Bahn are two minutes walk from the hotel too!
reviews.title: Superb experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms were spacious, clean and well presented. Check in staff were a delight and very helpful. We even received a 30 euro per day 'gift' to spend as we wanted (i.e. just drinks, just food or a mix of the two) in the (very nice) hotel tapas bar or restaurant. We didn't eat breakfast, but usually finished off our nights out with a drink at the bar.
reviews.title: Excellent for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We wouldn't hesitate to return to this hotel should we ever find ourselves in Berlin again (which I hope we will because it is a great city and we had a fantastic time).
reviews.title: Great location and breakfast buffet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good service, of course. Breakfast was great but pricey. If you become a Melia member you get 2 breakfast for the price of one. Good location on Friedrichstrasse and close to a train station to take you to other places. Good room. Will stay here again. Very good garage. If you like the location and the price is right. Book a room.
reviews.title: Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a fantastic stay at Melia Berlin.
reviews.title: Do not stay anywhere else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: A great location allowing easy rail transfer from the airport, as well as being centrally located for all the city centre sights and shops.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Using Melia's membership and online booking benefits our 3 night stay proved excellent value for money. I would recommend including breakfast as part of the deal - you will not regret it!
reviews.title: Excellent Value For Money, Good Quality Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff are super friendly and are keen for you to enjoy your holiday.
reviews.title: A modern hotel with old-fashioned service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brand new hotel in excellent location. Staff always helpful and service very good. Only criticisms are that the bar is in an open plan lobby and seemed underused as did the Tapas bar and restaurant. Perhaps the reason for this was the other bars and restaurants nearby. Just over the river the Ganymed Brasserie was top class if a little expensive, The Standige Vertretung was a big hit for beers and wholesome German food. Also across the bridge at Friedrichstrasse 113, Ristorante Peretti served up top class pasta dishes and mammoth pizzas at very low cost.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: There are a lot of high quality hotels in Berlin and Germany. This makes me pickier when it comes to giving points to this hotel. Any hotel that in a major European capital does not provide free internet is not in my opinion worthy of 5 star s no matter how cheap the internet is. The cost for internet connection is either 5 euro for one hour, 20 euro for 10 hours (with this option you can use internet discontinuously), 10 euro per day or another monthly option.
reviews.title: Good location, OK hotel, extra cgarge for internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is very good considering the number of transport options available and in fact considered central part of former East Berlin.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel close to River Spree

reviews.title: A Berlin Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The safe at least is for free. They provided me an XXL bathrobe with small slippers!
reviews.title: Everything you expect

description: Located in the heart of Berlin next to the River Spree and just a short distance from major attractions such as the Brandenburg Gate, Museum Island or Alexanderplatz.Warm colours in all 364 rooms, the exclusivity of the Executive Club “The Level”, highly personalised service, 1.200 sqm conference area with seven meeting rooms , the “Restaurant Café Madrid” and the bar “meliá tapas”. The Meliá Berlin is the perfect choice for your business or leisure trips to the city, thanks to an excellent location, extensive and comfortable facilities, and the quality of its services.
